Sentencas: Direct carbon solid oxide fuel cells (DC-SOFCs), which can efficiently convert chemical energy of carbonaceous fuels into electricity, have recently gained much research attention as they offer an effective way to address future economic and (PrBa)(0.95)Fe2-xTixO6-delta (PBFTx, x = 0-0.3) materials are synthesized via a sol-gel combustion method and evaluated as anode materials for DC-SOFCs.
Titulo: Fe-Based Layered Double Perovskite Anode with in Situ Exsolved Nanoparticles for Direct Carbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Ti doping enhances the phase structure stability of the material under a reducing atmosphere.
Titulo: Fe-Based Layered Double Perovskite Anode with in Situ Exsolved Nanoparticles for Direct Carbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Xray diffraction, scanning electron microscopy, and transmission electron microscopy analyses demonstrate the exsolution of metallic Fe nanoparticles on the surface of the PBFTx perovskite lattice after the materials are treated under a reducing atmosphere, which can improve the catalytic performance of DC-SOFC anode.
Titulo: Fe-Based Layered Double Perovskite Anode with in Situ Exsolved Nanoparticles for Direct Carbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Among the Ti-doped samples (x = 0.1-0.3), PBFT0.2 shows the largest adsorption capacity for CO and the highest electrical conductivity in air.
Titulo: Fe-Based Layered Double Perovskite Anode with in Situ Exsolved Nanoparticles for Direct Carbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Using pure nano-activated carbon as a fuel, the single cell supported by La0.9Sr0.1Ga0.8Mg0.2O3 electrolyte with PBFT0.2 as an anode achieves the maximum power densities of 527, 281, and 146 mW.cm(-2) at 800, 750, and 700 degrees C, respectively.
Titulo: Fe-Based Layered Double Perovskite Anode with in Situ Exsolved Nanoparticles for Direct Carbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The above excellent performance of PBFT0.2 indicates that it has great potential for application in DC-SOFC anode.
Titulo: Fe-Based Layered Double Perovskite Anode with in Situ Exsolved Nanoparticles for Direct Carbon Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
